_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:54:18 using v2.1
title: How have trusts breaching the 8 minute target for Red 1 and 2 calls changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
This graph shows the months in which there was a breach of the eight minute response target nationally. As shown, national breaches became particularly common as of July 2013, a trend that has continued up until January 2017.

A national breach generally corresponds with a breach in a majority of ambulance trusts. This suggests that a breach of the national target may be due to common factors across areas rather than just poorer performance in a few outlier trusts.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
